The post: s caption, written in simplified Chinese language, translates to English as: "The US Congress voted 49 to 46 to add the veto of Section 230 to the 2021 National Defense Authorization Act, which immediately became law after Trump signed it."
Screenshots of the tweet and similar cla: 4. A keyword search found that the 49-46 vote result actually happened when Nathan Simington was approved by the US Senate to join the Federal Communications Commission, and it was not related to the inclusion of Section 230 in the 2021 NDAA.
